title: Social Constructivist Language Learning Project: Strengthening Implicit Knowledge Sharing and Collaborative Expression Skills Within Organizations

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational organizational management and learning theory knowledge, experience with collaboration tools, and basic grammar and text analysis skills
context.additional_context: Team-based projects in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments emphasizing knowledge exchange. Focuses on holistically developing learners' linguistic expression (speaking/writing) and comprehension (listening/reading) skills

learning_goals: Learners design and implement collaborative projects that share organizational tacit knowledge through linguistic interactions (discussions, explanations, feedback).

Reflecting socioconstructivist principles (collaborative discussion, contextual learning, etc.), learners develop one knowledge management strategy per team, apply it to a real project (e.g., solving local community issues) over four weeks, and record weekly execution results in two-page reports using linguistic and visual elements.

Learners build an effective knowledge exchange system (utilizing text, voice, and images) in environments with limited technological resources (primarily smartphones) to enhance learners’ expressive and reading comprehension skills.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
